Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The dataset used for the analyses described in this manuscript was obtained from the database of Genotype and Phenotype (dbGaP) found at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gap [Accession Number: phs xxxxxx]. Samples and associated epigenomic marks and phenotypic data for the Epigenetic Analysis of Malnutrition were provided by David Auble, Ph.D., and William Petri, M.D., Ph.D. Epigenetic analyses of these samples were reported in [XXXXXXX] using samples obtained from the PROVIDE cohort, which is described in Kirkpatrick et al, Am J Trop Med Hyg 92(4), 2015, pp. 744­751. The PROVIDE study was supported by grant OPP1017093 from the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation (W. Petri, PI), by a gift from the Manning Family Foundation (D. Auble, PI), and by institutional support to D. Auble.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term:
The use of the “Epigenetic Analysis of Malnutrition” dataset requires local IRB approval. All requestors and data users must provide a local Institutional Review board [IRB] letter from their respective institution approving conduct of the proposed research project. Only full or expedited approvals will be accepted. The IRB letter must explicitly reference the use of the “Epigenetic Analysis of Malnutrition” dataset.
The progress report should specifically cite work done that relates to this dataset ["Epigenetic Analysis of Malnutrition"] and not just a generic report for a series of datasets that may have been requested.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.
